intro: Solanum okadae, commonly known as Okada's nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators. Its fruit is a smooth, orange-red berry that contains several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Solanum okadae is considered a rare and endangered species.
